attributes.action: give the people of this country a referendum with the question 'Should the people of this country take to the streets over the vile treatment meted out by the politicians of this country, in the same way as the brave people of Iran have protested over their vile treatment by their political elite'.
attributes.action_prefix: We the undersigned petition the Prime Minister to
attributes.background: What is going on in Tehran is a lesson to all of us in this country who have endured oppression; theft; disingenuity; deception; condescension and most of all violation of the human right to self-determination through his refusal to keep his promise over europe and his refusal to allow a general election which is what the majority of the country now want, by that vile abomination of a failed scottish constituency MP known as Gordon Brown who fraudulently occupies the office of Prime Minister in the English House of Commons.

rejection.details: The public already have the right to protest.
reasons: Statements that don't actually request any action
